Repository Name Unauthorized: Auburn University at Montgomery, Archives and Special Collections
Notes: The Archives and Special Collections unit was established in 1986 to preserve university records and to collect research materials in support of graduate instructioN  Holdings consist of 241 cubic feet of manuscript material, 160 cubic feet of archival records, 17,000 university photographs, 600 architectural drawings, and 6,000 monographs.  Significant subjects include the history of Auburn University at Montgomery; Montgomery, Autauga, and Elmore County histories; southern women's literature; Alabama literature, history and politics, and genealogy for the southern states.  The papers of novelists Lella Warren, Richard Marius, Wayne Greenhaw, Faye Gibbons, psychologist Erich Fromm, former state senator Otis J. Goodwyn, and Congressman William L. Dickinson are among the collections.  Also included are the records of the Capri Community Film Society.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
